alert.note: Alert for Macon; Marion; Schley; Stewart; Sumter; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 10:22PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Macon, southeastern Marion, southeastern Stewart, Webster, Schley and northwestern Sumter Counties through 1045 PM EDT... At 1021 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Buena Vista to Draneville to near Kimbrough to Sanford, and moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Americus, Buena Vista, Ellaville, Preston, Richland, Plains, Ideal, Weston, Putnam, Murrays Crossroads, Kimbrough, La Crosse, Draneville, Leveretts, Troutman, Friendship, Tazewell, Doyle, Bumphead and Church Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for west central Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Macon; Marion; Schley; Stewart; Sumter; Webster
